comment.text: Two episodes of perianal abscesses, one episode of brain abscess, adenitis and viral meningitis, idiopathic thrombocytopenia resistant to immunoglobulin and steroid therapy

comment.text: Three episodes of skin infection and protracted pneumonia, Bartolin gland infection

comment.text: Recurrent skin infections, pneumonia

comment.text: Recurrent respiratory infections, pneumonia, chronic otitis and sinusitis, recurrent tonsillitis and aphthous ulcers

comment.text: Anemia, thrombocytopenia, splenomegaly, cervical septic lymphadenitis, inflammatory bowel disease (leading to a subtotal colon resection), hypertension, myocardial and renal failure

comment.text: S. aureus dermatitis of the face and recurrent liver abscesses, which needed surgery and antibiotic treatment

comment.text: Ringworm, chest infections, gut inflammation diagnosed as Crohn's disease, fungal infection of the skin of his buttocks, four episodes of collapse of his left lung and multiple respiratory tract infections, bronchiectasis, perianal abscess and fistula, osteoporosis, lymphopenia

A point mutation in the intron 7 leading to aberrant splicing

comment.text: Pyelonephritis, Crohn's disease, perforated eardrum, respiratory tract infections, osteoporosis, retroperitoneal abscess

comment.text: Severe furunculosis of the skin and gastroenteritis, large mediastinal adenopathy proved to be of Mycobacterium tuberculosis etiology, cervical suppurative lymphadenitis and recurrent furunculosis of the face, extremities and back, which required combined surgical excicion and parenteral antibiotics, left upper and lower lobe pneumonia caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis

consequence.term: A point mutation in the intron 2 leading to aberrant splicing
A point mutation in the exon 7 leading to a premature stop codon
